results.title: Anti-Obesity Medication Use in Children and Adolescents with Prader-Willi Syndrome: Case Review and Literature Search
results.text_hl: The most common reported side effect in the studies was increased @DISEASE_Disorders_of_Excessive_Somnolence @DISEASE_MESH:D006970 @@@somnolence@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ also showed improved @<m>DISEASE_Hyperphagia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006963 @@@hyperphagia@@@ without @DISEASE_Weight_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@weight loss@@@.

citations.NLM: Goldman VE, Naguib MN, Vidmar AP. Anti-Obesity Medication Use in Children and Adolescents with Prader-Willi Syndrome: Case Review and Literature Search J Clin Med. 2021 Sep 30;10(19):. PMID: 34640558
citations.BibTeX: @article{34640558, title={Anti-Obesity Medication Use in Children and Adolescents with Prader-Willi Syndrome: Case Review and Literature Search}, author={Goldman VE and Naguib MN and Vidmar AP}, journal={J Clin Med}, volume={10}, number={19}}

results.title: Metformin ameliorates olanzapine-induced disturbances in POMC neuron number, axonal projection, and hypothalamic leptin resistance
results.text_hl: These findings suggest that @CHEMICAL_Olanzapine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077152 @@@olanzapine@@@-induced hypothalamic @GENE_POMC @GENE_18976 @@@POMC@@@ neuron abnormality and @GENE_LEP @GENE_16846 @@@leptin@@@ resistance, which can be ameliorated by @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ administration, are the possible causes of subsequent @<m>DISEASE_Hyperphagia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006963 @@@hyperphagia@@@.

citations.NLM: Kim J, Lee N, Suh SB, Jang S, Kim S, Kim DG, Park JK, Lee KW, Choi SY, Lee CH. Metformin ameliorates olanzapine-induced disturbances in POMC neuron number, axonal projection, and hypothalamic leptin resistance BMB Rep. 2022 Jun;55(6):293-298. PMID: 35651327
citations.BibTeX: @article{35651327, title={Metformin ameliorates olanzapine-induced disturbances in POMC neuron number, axonal projection, and hypothalamic leptin resistance}, author={Kim J and Lee N and Suh SB and Jang S and Kim S and Kim DG and Park JK and Lee KW and Choi SY and Lee CH}, journal={BMB Rep}, volume={55}, number={6}, pages={293-298}}

results.title: Early metformin treatment improves pancreatic function and prevents metabolic dysfunction in early overfeeding male rats at adulthood.
results.text_hl: During the first 12 days of suckling, animals from SL and NL groups received @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, whereas the controls received saline injections.

citations.NLM: Previate C, Malta A, Miranda RA, Martins IP, Pavanello A, de Oliveira JC, Prates KV, Alves VS, Francisco FA, Moreira VM, Matiusso CCI, de Moraes AMP, Mathias PCF, Franco CCDS. Early metformin treatment improves pancreatic function and prevents metabolic dysfunction in early overfeeding male rats at adulthood. Exp Physiol. 2020 Dec;105(12):2051-2060. PMID: 33074581

results.title: Prader-Willi Syndrome: Possibilities of Weight Gain Prevention and Treatment
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ treatment improved food-related distress and @DISEASE_Anxiety @DISEASE_MESH:D001007 @@@anxiety@@@, evaluated by @<m>DISEASE_Hyperphagia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006963 @@@Hyperphagia@@@ Questionnaire; however, @DISEASE_Weight_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@weight reduction@@@ did not occur..

citations.NLM: Erhardt É, Molnár D. Prader-Willi Syndrome: Possibilities of Weight Gain Prevention and Treatment Nutrients. 2022 May 6;14(9):. PMID: 35565916
citations.BibTeX: @article{35565916, title={Prader-Willi Syndrome: Possibilities of Weight Gain Prevention and Treatment}, author={Erhardt É and Molnár D}, journal={Nutrients}, volume={14}, number={9}}

results.title: Exploring the therapeutic potential of chlorogenic acid in alleviating olanzapine-induced metabolic syndrome in rats: a key role of hypothalamic satiety proteins.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Chlorogenic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002726 @@@CGA@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Met@@@ mitigated these effects, although @CHEMICAL_Olanzapine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077152 @@@Olz@@@-induced elevation of @GENE_ADIPOQ @GENE_246253 @@@adiponectin@@@ levels remained unaffected by either treatment.

citations.NLM: Ebrahimian Z, Razavi BM, Mousavi Shaegh SA, Hosseinzadeh H. Exploring the therapeutic potential of chlorogenic acid in alleviating olanzapine-induced metabolic syndrome in rats: a key role of hypothalamic satiety proteins. Nutr Neurosci. 2025 Feb 9;():1-20. PMID: 39924659

results.title: Effects of metformin in children and adolescents with Prader-Willi syndrome and early-onset morbid obesity: a pilot study.
results.text_hl: We administered the @<m>DISEASE_Hyperphagia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006963 @@@Hyperphagia@@@ Questionnaire to parents of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ before and after starting @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment.

citations.NLM: Miller JL, Linville TD, Dykens EM. Effects of metformin in children and adolescents with Prader-Willi syndrome and early-onset morbid obesity: a pilot study. J Pediatr Endocrinol Metab. 2014 Jan;27(1-2):23-9. PMID: 23893676

results.title: Markedly improved glycemic control and enhanced insulin sensitivity in a patient with type 2 diabetes complicated by a suprasellar tumor treated with pioglitazone and metformin.
results.text_hl: Additionally, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment showed marked anorectic effects on the @<m>DISEASE_Hyperphagia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006963 @@@hyperphagia@@@.
